resources.string: Removes least likely results.Â If results have been trimmed, output will be followed by an astrisk (*). Default: true
Show only unrecognized words. Default: false
Ignore capitalized words longer than three letters if they are not in the dictionary, instead of printing UNKNOWN. Default: true
Ignore words in all caps if they are not in the dictionary, instead of printing UNKNOWN. Default: true
Look ahead for the verb TO_BE (or iri) when it finds a verb participle, with the expectation of finding a compound perfect tense or periphastic. Default: true
When a result for a word is not found, try again with various prefixes and suffixes. Generally useful, but sometimes yields false positives. Default: true

When a result is not found, try replacements like cl -> cul, vul -> vol, ads -> ass, inp -> imp, etc., to provide for recognized variants of classical spelling, though false positives can result. Default: true
Output line with forms associated with dictionary entry (nom/gen for noun, etc.). Default: false
Show what during periods a word/inflection was in use. Default: true
Show how frequently a word/inflection was used. Default: true
Provide examples for usage of case/tenses/etc. Produces lengthy output. Default: false
Output meaning without inflection details. Default: false

When unable to find a proper match in the dictionary, list the dictionary entries around the unknown. This will likely catch a substantive for which only the ADJ stem appears in dictionary, an ADJ for which there is only a N stem, etc. Default: false
Displays result while you type, without needing to press search. Default: false
